content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is sitting reading a book and hears the bed in Joey’s room creaking, and does a ‘Oh no, not again’ look on his face.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: WHOAA!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See Joe, that’s why your parents told you not to jump on the bed.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Rachel are entering

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, look at me. I’m making jam, been at it since 4 o’clock this morning.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where’d you get fruit at four in the morning?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Went down to the docks. Bet ya didn’t know you could get it wholesale.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I didn’t know there were docks.
[Joey and Chandler enter]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aww, is it broken?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I gotta wear this thing for a couple weeks. (points to the sling he is wearing)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Did you tell the doctor you did it jumping up and down on your bed?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo. I had a story all worked out but then Chandler sold me out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I’m sorry Joe. I didn’t think the doctor was gonna buy that it just *fell* out of the socket.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What is this? Fruit?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica’s making jam.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, jam! I love jam! (to Chandler) Hey, how come we never have jam at our place?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because the kids need new shoes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m going into business people. I’m sick and tired of being depressed about Richard. I needed a plan, a plan to get over my man. What’s the opposite of man? Jam. (sees Joey trying some jam from the pot) Oh Joey don’t! It’s way to hot. (Joey realizes this and spits what he had in his mouth back into the pot.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This will just be my batch.

content.description: Street, Phoebe is being followed by some guy, as they pass a flower vendor. Phoebe turns around and the guy quickly picks up some flowers and continues following her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, that’s it. No. Hey! You! J. Crew guy. Yeah. Why have you been following me? I mean, all week long everywhere I look there’s you.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: You wouldn’t return my calls, you sent back my letters…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: One more chance Ursula, please?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oooh. Oh, well this is awkward.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Wh..

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, yeah, you want Ursula, and I’m Phoebe. Twin sisters! Seriously.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Oh, that’s great. I’m stalking the wrong woman. I am such a dingus!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, you’re not a dingus.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: I just, I want you to know I didn’t used to be like this. Before I meet your sister I was like this normal guy who sold beepers and cellular phones.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I mean look it’s, it’s not your fault, you know. I mean this is just what, what she does to guys, okay.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Well thanks. (starts to leave)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, (grabs him) you know what, I got a little story. When I was in Junior High School I went through this period where I thought I was a witch. And there was this guidance counselor who said something to me, that I think will help you a lot. He said okay, ‘you’re not a witch you’re just an average student.’ See what I’m saying?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Not really.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, well, get over it. So, I mean you, you just seem to be a really nice guy, you know. Don’t be so hard on yourself okay.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Wait. You’re right. I know you’re right. And, thanks for being so nice. Here (gives her the flowers he bought.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, thanks a lot. Do you want to get a cup of coffee?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Yeah, okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. (they start to leave, he is still following her) Okay, you don’t have to walk behind me any more.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Sorry.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Rachel are entering

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mon?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: ‘Gone for more jars. Back later. Monica Geller.’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, look.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, look, look.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, what, what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s an empty apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oooh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re all alone in an empty apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, come on, I have to be at work in like ten minutes (Ross starts kissing her neck) Oh, all right, well it’s not like I’m employee of the year or anything. (they fall onto the couch)
(Chandler enters and they both jump up and pretend that Ross is showing her something in the couch.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There it is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, oh, that’s what you’re talking about. (to Chandler) Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do I look fat?

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Noo.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, I accept that. When Janice asked me and I said no, she took that to mean that I was calling her a cow.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, walk us through it, honey, walk us through it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, well. Janice said ‘Hi, do I look fat today?’ And I, I looked at her…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You looked at her. You never look. You just answer, it’s just a reflex. Do I look fat? Nooo! Is she prettier than I am? Noo! Does size matter?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And it works both ways.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so you both just know this stuff?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well you know, after about thirty or forty fights, you kinda catch on.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, for instance. Let’s say, Janice is coming back from a trip and she gives you two options. Option number 1 she’ll take a cab home from the airport. Option 2 is you can meet her at baggage claim. Which do you do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s easy, baggage claim.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wrong! Now you’re single. It’s actually secret option number three, you meet her at the gate. That way she knows you love her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, this is good, this is good. All right listen, I have one. Janice likes to cuddle, at night, which, you know I’m all for. But, uh, you know when you want to go to sleep, you want some space. So, uh, how do I tell her that without, you know, accidentally calling her fat or something.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, I’m sorry we can’t help you there, ’cause we’re cuddlily sleepers. (Chandler makes an ‘Ewww’ face) Okay, I’m late for work.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right are you guys gonna come down?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, yeah, yeah I’ll, I’m right behind you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good luck Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Bye sweetie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye hon.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay the sleeping thing. Very tricky business, but there is something you can do.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I thought you guys were cuddlily sleepers.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Noo! No, not cuddlily, not me, just her. I’m like you, I need the room. Okay, come here. (they sit on the couch and Ross puts his hands on Chandler’s shoulder and thigh.) Okay, you’re in bed…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. (they both notice where his hands are)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna use the cushion.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, you’re in bed. She’s over on your side, cuddling. Now you wait for her to drift off, and then you hug her (demonstrates on the cushion) and roll her back over to her side of the bed. And then you rollll a-way. Hug for her! Roll for you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, the old hug and roll.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, one question.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shoot.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re pretending the pillow’s a girl right?

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is putting jam on his muffin, lots of jam

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Remember when you where a kid and your Mom would drop you off at the movies with a jar of jam and a little spoon?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re so pretty.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, oh, you know that guy who’s been following me? I talked to him today.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You talked to him. Are you crazy?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, first I’m not crazy. And second, say it don’t spray it. Anyway his name is Malcom, and he wasn’t following me, I mean he was, but ’cause he thought I was Ursula, ick. And, that’s why, that’s why he couldn’t just come up and talk to me. ’Cause of the restraining order.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Umm, not feeling better ‘bout Malcom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! No, no, no, no, he’s not like a kook, no. He’s just like this, this very passionate, incredibly romantic guy, that got like a tinsy bit carried away, you know. And we just get along really well, and he’s so cute.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God, you’ve got a crush on your sister’s stalker.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I’m just gonna help him, you know, get ’de-Ursula-ized’, like you know, like I did for Joey after he went out with her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I didn’t stalk her. I mean (he sprays Phoebe with crumbs)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I asked for the news, not the weather.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey guys.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey Mon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, this is for you. (gives him a jar of jam) It’s blackberry curin.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww. (tastes it) Ohh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, Joe, I gotta ask. The girl from the Xerox place buck naked (holds up one hand), or, or a big tub of jam. (holds up the other hand)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Put your hands together.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, take your time with that. That’s my last batch.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No more jam?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what happened to your jam plan?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I figured out I need to charge seventeen bucks a jar just to break even. So, I’ve got a new plan now. Babies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, your gonna need much bigger jars.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m talking about me having a baby.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. The great thing about the jam plan was, I was taking control of my life. So I asked myself, what is the most important thing to me in the world and that’s when I came up with the baby plan.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, aren’t you forgetin’ something? What, what, what is uh, what is that guy’s name? Dad!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It took me 28 years to find one man that I wanna spend my life with, if I have to wait another 28 years then, I’ll be 56 before I can have a baby, and that’s just stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That, that’s what’s stupid.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t need an actual man, just a couple of his best swimmers. And there, there are places you can go to get that stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Down at the docks again?

content.description: Chandler’s bedroom, Janice and him are cuddling

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Night-night Bing-a-ling.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Night-night…Janice. (he starts thinking to him self) ’Look at all that room on her side, you good fit a giant penguin over there. That would be weird though. Okay, hug and roll time. I’m huggin’, I’m huggin’, your rollin’, and…yes! Freedom! (his one arm is still under her) Except for this arm! I’m stuck. Stuck arm! Okay, time for the old table cloth trick, one fluid motion. Quick like a cat, quick like a cat! And 1…2…3!’ (Pulls his arm out from under her and she is spun off of the bed.)

content.description: Central Perk, Malcom is giving Phoebe all of his spy stuff

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: Here’s my binoculars.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, great. Great. You’re doing great, you know real strong. Going strong. Keep going.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: These are my night vision goggles. This is the book I pretend to read when I’m watching her in the park. And these are Mad Lips, they’re just for fun.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah. What’s this? (picks up a book)

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: Oh, this is log I kept, recording her every movement. Do you wanna here something from it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, not even a little bit.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: It’s about you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay then.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: I met Phoebe today. She was really nice to me eventhough I’m such a loser. And, then when I was walking home I thought about her a lot, it was weird, but kinda cool.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good. So what were you thinking?

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: I was thinking what it would be like to kiss you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: See that’s just something I said now, so that maybe I could kiss you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay. (he kisses her)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is eating jam straight out of the jar, and Chandler is staring at him in amazement. Joey offers him some.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, that’s all right. I just had a jar of mustard.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, sperm donor number 03815, come on down! Okay, he’s 6’2”, 170 pounds, and he describes himself as a male Geena Davis.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean there’s more than one of us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, you can’t do this Mon. All right, if you do this, I’m, I’m gonna, I’m, I’m gonna…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re gonna what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna tell Mom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, I’m sorry, but he’s right. I love you, but you’re crazy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Crazy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! Why? Why is this crazy? So this isn’t the ideal way to something…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, it’s not the ideal way…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Lips moving, still talking. I mean it may not be ideal, but I’m so ready. No, I-I-I see the way Ben looks at you. It makes me ache, you know?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check it out!! Jam crackers!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, all right, how’s this? 27. Italian-American guy. He’s an actor, born in Queens. Wow, big family, seven sisters, and he’s the only…boy. (they all turn and look at Joey) Oh my God, under personal comments: ‘New York Knicks, rule!’

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, the Knicks rule!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, this is you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let me see. (goes over and looks at the form) Oh, right.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: When did you go to a sperm bank?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, right after I did that sex study down at NYU. (to Chandler) Hey, Remember that sweater I gave you for your birthday?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And that’s how you bought it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Noooo, that’s what I was wearing when I donated. I’m kinda surprised there’s any of my boys left.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, honey, it is pretty competitive. I mean I’ve got an actual rocket scientist here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe, I should call this place and get them to put my ’days of Our Lives’ on here. You know, juice this puppy up a little.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hellooo!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How’s the maniac?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well he’s yummy. We did a little kissin’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, what are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, no, no, no, no. You know what, he’s not into that stuff anymore. He quit for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, this guy has been obsessed with your sister, for God knows how long, okay, you don’t just give up something like that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, he gave me his night vision goggles and everything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re taking the word of a guy who has night vision goggles?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What, he’s not still following her. Do you think he is still following her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs, wake up and smell the restraining order.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you saying I should do?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think, that if you really like this guy, you should just trust him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you, Monica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Orrr, you could follow him and see where he goes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s what I would do, forget mine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, what happened? (points to the cast on Janice’s wrist)

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh. God, crazy Chandler. He spun me…off…the…bed!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Spinning that sounds like fun.

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: Oh, (laughs) I wish. No, you know he was just trying Ross’s Hug and Roll thing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross’s what?

content.speaker: Janice
content.text: You know what, where he hugs you and kinda rolls you away and… Oh… my…God.

content.description: Subway station, Phoebe is following Malcom by finding behind the pillars until she comes up to one with a wire mesh garbage can next to it. Malcom stops and starts walking the other way and passes Phoebe, who quick tries to hide behind the garbage can. But, Malcom sees her.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes? Yes! Oh.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I was just here looking for, um, my um, my part of an old sandwich. Oh, here it is! Oh. (picks one up out of the garbage can.)

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: Were you following me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, perhaps. Yes! Yes, I’m sorry, I’m sorry. I was just afraid that you were still hung up on my sister.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: So you spied on me. I can’t believe you don’t trust me. (Ursula walks past, and Malcom finds behind the pillar)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh well, what do you know, there goes my identical twin sister. Just walkin’ along looking like me. What, is this just like a freakish coincidence, or did you know she takes this train?

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry. I tried to stop, but I couldn’t. I’m so pathetic.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, it’s not your fault. You know it’s partly my fault, ’cause I made you quit cold turkey. Sorry, no. Okay, well, I mean, I can’t date you anymore, ’cause your, you know (in a high pitched voice) Wow! But um, but I will definitely, definitely help you get over my sister. Okay, stalk me for a while. Huh? Yeah, and, and, and, I’ll be like an Ursula patch.

content.speaker: Malcom
content.text: Uh-huh, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, just, okay, look I’m going. Um, come on. Op, op, behind the pillar, which way am I gonna go?

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where you going?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: To the bank.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sperm or regular?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sperm.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you’re really doing this, huh?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah, picked a guy, 37135.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sounds nice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘Fraid so. Brown hair, green eyes…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No kiddin’, hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I-I figured you would’ve picked a blond guy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Why?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know, I just always pictured you ending up with one of those tall, smart blond guys, name like… Hoyt.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hoyt?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s a name, yeah. I saw you, you know, in this great house with a big pool.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really, is he a swimmer?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s got the body for it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I like that. (Joey starts laughing) What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys have one of those signs that says: ‘We don’t swim in your toilet, so don’t pee in our pool.’, you know.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We do not have one of those signs.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure you do, it was a gift from me. Oh! And you have these three great kids.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Two girls and a boy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And, and, and they wear those little water wings, you know. And they’re, they’re running around on the deck. Then Hoyt wraps this big towel around all three of them.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure! (Monica gets very depressed) But hey, you know this way sounds good too.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh Monica. (goes over and hugs her, then looks at the form and stops hugging her.) Wow, this guy’s an astronaut. That would’ve been cool, (sees Monica) for like a day. (hugs her again).

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is finishing off the last of the jam]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I called the sperm bank today, they haven’t sold a single unit of Tribianni. Nobody wants my product. I mean, I-I-I don’t get it (tries to drink the rest of the jam out of the jar and gets it all over his face, on his chin, nose, etc.) Maybe if they met me in person.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, you got a little thing on your…(points to her whole face)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did I get it?
content.parenthetical: wipes a little jam from the corner of his mouth

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey. (walks into the living room) Uh, Chan, can I uh, can I talk to you for a second?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Sure. What’s up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just one uh, one additional relationship thought. Probably something your already familiar with, uh, women talk! (smacks Chandler over the head with a magazine)
